description: Rada Miskovic, driven by mounting unrest and provided with evidence from grassroots contacts, decides to make public the files exposing years of engineered resource deprivation under the BCI. She prepares the exposé and coordinates with local organizers for maximum impact.

Rada's exposé airs, revealing the BCI’s targeted rationing in low-score districts since Halden’s data centralization. She calls for reparations and challenges the Council to address the deprivation openly.

Grassroots data analysts corroborate Rada’s report, releasing a detailed BCI resource map. Marginalized communities rally, organize protests, and declare a refusal to follow city directives until demands are addressed.

Under escalating public pressure, Council factions hold an emergency session. Oksana Lintz and other officials face scrutiny over past resource decisions, setting the stage for negotiations about reparations.
The Council presents a temporary redistribution plan, but protests continue as residents debate the adequacy of the response and call for comprehensive reform of the BCI system.
